Akhila Manthena

Co-Director

Akhila is a Biomathematics major, graduating May 2020.

Why is Mental Health Important to You?
"I believe that our senses and our perspective of the world are processed in our mind. So our mental health affects the lens in which we see the world and ultimately that becomes our reality. If we take care of ourselves, we can live with happiness and clarity."

Monika Baskaran

Co-Director

Monika is a Public Health major, with a Health and Society minor, graduating May 2020.

Why is Mental Health Important to You?
"Mental Health impacts every aspect of my daily life. It affects my thoughts, emotions, and how I face stress. Through this organization, I want to guide others to a positive mental health path."

Samantha Ayudant

Events Coordinator

Sam is a Psychology major, with a Health and Society minor, graduating May 2020.

Why is Mental Health Important to You?
"As a Psychology major, I plan on becoming a psychologist, so mental health is a priority to me. I wish to use my knowledge to give back to those in need."

Dina Doctoroff

Public Relations Coordinator

Dina is a Psychology major graduating May 2022.

Why is Mental Health Important to You?
"Mental health is important to me because it influences all aspects of our lives. If your mental health is impaired, it’s hard to function normally and complete daily tasks. It’s important to erase the negative stigma that comes with mental health issues so everyone can get the proper treatment and care they need. "

Tyra Foster

Public Relations Coordinator

Tyra is an Information Technology and Informatics (ITI) major, with a minor in Chinese, graduating May 2020.

Why is Mental Health Important to You?
"Mental health is important because there's a stigma that talking about mental health is bad. I believe that talking about it is the only way to help everyone in the long run. We have to bring awareness to not only the bad days but the good ones too."

Sneha Manikandan

Public Relations Coordinator

Sneha is a Cell Biology and Neuroscience (CBN) major, with a Computer Science minor, graduaing May 2020.

Why is Mental Health Important to You?
"Mental health is an ubiquitous issue that is very often overlooked. I think it's important to bring awareness to it so people can be health both physically and mentally."

Jayce Palamattam

Blogger

Jayce is a Nursing major, graduating May 2020.

Why is Mental Health Important to You?
"Mental health is an issue that affects every single person at some point in their lives. Not only have I gone through anxiety, but I have also watched loved ones go through the worst seasons of their lives because of depression. I remember feeling so helpless at the time. When we see someone struggling, we need to lift them up, which is something that all of us can do together."

Kia Ansine

Newsletter Editor

Kia is an Exercise Science major graduating Fall 2021.

Why is Mental Health Important to You?
"Mental health is important to me, because it influences our thoughts, perception, and attitude about our lives. Even though we may not be able to control what happens to us, we can be better able to cope with challenges if we are given access to quality mental wellness resources."

Varsini Manikandan

Podcast Editor

Varsini is a Biology major graduating May 2020.

Why is Mental Health Important to You?
"Mental health affects every aspect of our lives and everyone experiences it. Poor mental health can even cause simple but vital tasks such as sleeping or eating to be difficult. It is so important to recognize the symptoms, raise awareness, and provide a space for those with mental health problems to share so they can get the help they need."

Sanjana Pendharkar

Web Designer

Sanjana is a Computer Science major, with a minor in Biology, graduating May 2021.

Why is Mental Health Important to You?
"Mental health remains a stigmatized issue that is regarded less serious than a physical illness because it cannot be seen. Depression and anxiety rates have soared amongst college students, making it a priority to address within the Rutgers community."

Shivani Mehra

Senior Executive Advisor

Shivani graduated from Rutgers in May 2018, with a dual Genetics and Psychology degree.

Why is Mental Health Important to You?
"Mental health is important because it affects everyone at someone point in their lives. It is important to practice self-care, otherwise, we would not be able to achieve happiness in our lives."
